text:
I think there is a big `issue` related to the copy of CM to other portals (hope this is not happening to the marketplace too).
If you clone a module with a linked file (JS in my case) it will be cloned too, but if you click on edit that file (from the new portal) the link is broken, and its broken also on the fronted (so the library is not loading). I am guessing the `file id` of the attached file is not being updated with the new file in the new portal
Thank you for reporting. We are actively working on a fix.
Copying modules across portals should work as expected now. We are working to resolve an issue with Marketplace delivery currently, but it should be resolved shortly.
<@U2H1YLSE6> did either of these suggestions work for you?
Yeah I just cloned the HTML module from the marketplace, and added the fields I needed
have you seen .js being stripped out - we can no longer get that to stick after cloning the HTML module :disappointed:
How are you doing the JS, in a `<script>` tag?
seems to be working for me
tnx. maybe it is the structure or syntax of the 3rd party script. it keeps getting stripped out.

Got an old bug bugging me that’s been around since the early beta days of the new design manager, I’ve reported it multiple times, still experiencing it.

If you:
1. clone a module from portal A  to Portal B.
2. move cloned module from the folder it’s in to another folder
3. delete the folder the module brought over with it.
4. Module works fine and is visible, and that folder is correctly not visible in the finder (it’s supposed to be deleted)
5. Now clone another custom module from Portal A to portal B
6. This module and any associated files are now floating in outer space :rocket: The module and the files exist and can be found using the search but cannot be seen in the finder thus cannot be moved, renamed or cloned elsewhere.

The “deleted” folder shows in FTP and you can see the files/modules located within.

Fortunately using FTP you can fix the issue yourself. But before the designs folder was added to the FTP there was nothing you could do at all

I’ve used the FTP method to solve my current problem, but would appreciate it if someone fixed this as we clone modules a lot, and we delete the containing folders because they reference the other site
Marketplace assets are now working as expected as well.
